pr_title: fix: Respect sharing setting during event saving

timeline.message: fix: Respect sharing setting in event saving

timeline.bodyText: Can you add the new argument to the list of Javadoc arguments for the method?
timeline.author: luciano-fiandesio
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -170,7 +170,7 @@ ProgramStageInstance createProgramStageInstance( ProgramInstance programInstance
      * @param singleValue specifies whether the update is a single value update
      */
     void auditDataValuesChangesAndHandleFileDataValues( Set<EventDataValue> newDataValues, Set<EventDataValue> updatedDataValues,Set<EventDataValue> removedDataValues,
-        Map<String, DataElement> dataElementsCache, ProgramStageInstance programStageInstance, boolean singleValue );

revised_code.chunk:
diff --git a/dhis-2/dhis-api/src/main/java/org/hisp/dhis/program/ProgramStageInstanceService.java b/dhis-2/dhis-api/src/main/java/org/hisp/dhis/program/ProgramStageInstanceService.java
index fee3d97678..e9a596ad91 100644
--- a/dhis-2/dhis-api/src/main/java/org/hisp/dhis/program/ProgramStageInstanceService.java
+++ b/dhis-2/dhis-api/src/main/java/org/hisp/dhis/program/ProgramStageInstanceService.java

@@ -166,6 +166,7 @@ public interface ProgramStageInstanceService
      * @param updatedDataValues EventDataValues to update
      * @param removedDataValues EventDataValues to remove
      * @param dataElementsCache DataElements cache map with DataElements required for creating audit logs for changed EventDataValues
+     * @param nonAccessibleDataElements DataElements whose values are non-accessible to the current user
      * @param programStageInstance programStageInstance to which the EventDataValues belongs to
      * @param singleValue specifies whether the update is a single value update
      */

timeline.bodyText:
minor: can you format to respect the 80 chars line length:
Set<EventDataValue> nonAccessibleDataValues = programStageInstance.getEventDataValues().stream()
    .filter( dv -> nonAccessibleDataElements.contains( dv.getDataElement() ) )
    .collect( Collectors.toSet() );
timeline.author: luciano-fiandesio

timeline.bodyText:
minor: can you reformat to respect 80 chars length
programStageInstanceService.auditDataValuesChangesAndHandleFileDataValues( newDataValues, updatedDataValues,
    removedDataValuesDueToEmptyValue, dataElementsCache, nonAccessibleDataElements, programStageInstance,
    singleValue )
timeline.author: luciano-fiandesio

timeline.bodyText: the call to trackerAccessManager.canWrite( importOptions.getUser(), programStageInstance, dataElement, true ) is taking place also at line 125 (inside validateDataValue). I understand that this new block of code (from line 137 to 145) is required for the auditing. Can we somehow avoid the call to this canWrite method a second time?
timeline.author: luciano-fiandesio

replies.bodyText: we are not checking canWritefor the same object. otherwise we need to refactor the entire class, because the way it is written today focuses only on the incoming payload. what we are checking the second time (at least in the ACL) is those not in the payload.
replies.author: abyot
